conclusion: Consider principles of shadow formation and effect of light source movement.
Shadows will generally move away from the objects when the light source moves forward.
Objects closer to the light source will cast longer shadows.
Objects further away from the light source will cast shorter shadows.
Hand (A) and fruit (D) shadows will shift directly away from their base.
Typewriter (B) shadow will move away from its base and elongate.
Bird (C) shadow will move directly below it, elongating as it moves away.
Shadows have moved away from their respective objects and have become longer.
A (Hand) shadow moves to the right and elongates.
B (Typewriter) shadow moves directly away and slightly elongates.
C (Bird) shadow moves directly below and elongates significantly.
D (Fruit) shadow moves to the right and elongates.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D move away from objects and elongate.
